title: EIAT User Guide
text: Economic Impact Assessment Tool (EIAT) allows users estimate impact investment activity region (Local Government Area) terms Gross Regional Product (GRP) full time equivalent (FTE) employment1. Underpinning EIAT Input-Output tables Australia individual LGAs. Input-Output tables represent expenditure flows industries terms purchases sales. also contain primary inputs production wages salaries (labour input) value added. Input-Output tables quantify structure economy. Australian Bureau Statistics generates Input-Output table year, describes Australian economy terms 115 industry groups. Input-Output modelling uses Input-Output tables quantify impact expenditure one industry based industry makes purchases. example, order build new road, (direct expenditure) construction company must purchase goods services construction companies, well businesses sectors economy, may include chemicals, machinery equipment, electricity, well direct labour. turn, businesses sell goods services construction company also make purchases. machinery equipment hire business makes purchases industries, utilises direct labour employees. Employees also spend labour income consumable goods food drink, workwear. additional purchases (indirect expenditures) can added direct effect construction project create estimate total impact. flow direct expenditure continue without limit input-output tables leaky. Expenditures occur outside economy (ie, expenditures imported) contribute.

title: EIAT User Guide
text: use input-output model imposes number assumptions must considered interpreting predicted impacts. important assumptions : Increases demand region serviced industries constant proportions, significant price adjustments occur. Industries linear production function, implies constant returns scale, fixed input proportions. Firms within sector homogeneous, implies produce fixed set products produced sector, input structure firms . model static model take account dynamic processes involved adjustments external change. private public stakeholders can use tool conduct preliminary Input-Ouput analysis, recommended expert consultants engaged full detailed report estimations economic impacts, interpretations.

title: EIAT User Guide
text: using EIAT important user considers investment analysed interacts region occur. important consideration much expenditure occur within region. expenditure occurs outside region can used estimate either economic impact terms Gross Regional Product, employment. tool designed correct , provide warnings errors expenditure outside region included input data. analyst therefore local knowledge economic structure region order estimate much potentially sourced within region. data collected, EIAT can accessed . landing page provides description tool, summary data used, current version Regional Input-Output tables. also reiterates assumptions present Input-Output modelling, information required use tool correctly.

title: EIAT User Guide
text: project parameters can adjusted selecting Project Setup navigation bar top page. First select State, Local Government Area interest.

title: EIAT User Guide
text: two options enter data tool. relatively simple analyses user can first select number years future investment continue. default set 1, first year current year.  Next, enter direct capital expenditure industry sector table. Remember expenditures must basic (sometimes called producer) prices - , exclude margins, taxes, subsidies - must expenditure occur (expected occur) within region.  complex analysis want keep record estimated expenditures, template can downloaded, based parameters set , can opened Microsoft Excel, OpenOffice, Google Sheets. file can renamed, .csv files accepted tool. data entered template, can uploaded using ‘Uploaded Data’ button. Sometimes, something may go wrong. EIAT expects file uploaded file look like file previously downloaded. uploaded file many years data appropriate column names, tool issue warning still upload data. EIAT read uploaded file, show error reset data.

title: EIAT User Guide
text: direct capital expenditure data entered, summary input data can obtained selecting Input Summary tab navigation panel. Summary tables display total direct capital expenditure region year, industry year. tables can downloaded, copied clipboard, printed, clicking relevant button.  Summary graphs visualise input data year, industry year. graphs can also downloaded .png, .jpeg, .pdf using controls shown graph.  estimated economic impacts terms employment, GRP can seen selecting Economic Impacts tab navigation panel. employment impacts, GRP impacts, annual total tables graphs can viewed. annual impacts table shows estimated Direct, Flow-Total employment GRP generated direct capital expenditure entered tool. years data can exported, viewed graph. Multiple years can selected annual impacts tables. tables now show Direct Flow-values, Totals impact year data entered. total impacts table shows total estimated Direct, Flow-, Total employment GRP generated across entire duration investment - .e. summed years.

title: EIAT User Guide
text: report summarising economic impact assessment project can automatically generated selecting Report navigation panel. report can produced PDF Microsoft Word Document, users can define content selecting tables graphs included.

title: EIAT User Guide
text: tool includes 19 sector version national input-output table, summary employment selected region, derived 19 sector version regional input-output table, selected region. can exported Excel.

title: EIAT User Guide
text: proposed upgrade existing road South Australian Local Government Area Adelaide Hills. road construction estimated cost $10 million two years, design surveying occur first year, bulk construction occur second year. economic impact project Adelaide Hills region can estimated using EIAT. , user must consider allocate $10 million dollars expenditure - across time across industries. user knows local area well knows road upgrade relatively simple - tunnels grade separation. estimate 20% total project cost occur design surveying phase, occurring first year. user also knows design carried local firm, surveying done firm another part South Australia. additional $1 million estimated support hiring site offices facilities, local firm. user also estimates although construction begin 2023, majority construction activity occur 2024. also choose make estimate much construction activity can sourced within Adelaide Hills LGA. Given size project, local knowledge industry, user makes conservative estimate construction company need import half products services require project. , user decides allocate direct capital expenditure across three industry sectors. $1.5 million (Design) $0 million (Surveying) $1.5 million (Design) $0 million (Surveying)

title: EIAT User Guide
text: Input Summary tab shows expenditure allocated across industries across years. Note although project estimated cost $10 million, $6 million allocated region. Economic Impacts tab shows economic impact project. 2023, project generate 7 Full Time Equivalent (FTE) employees direct result expenditure. additional 6 FTE generated Flow-effects expenditure economy. Overall, 13 FTE created 2023, majority (7) occurring Professional, Scientific Technical Services sector. 2024, 19 FTE created. app, results can found Economic Impacts > Employment Impacts > Annual Impact Results.

title: EIAT User Guide
text: EIAT draws data following sources: Australian Bureau Statistics Census 2021 Census provides information number people work region industry, number people work live region industry. data set accessed ABS TableBuilder Pro 2021 Census - counting persons, 15 years . INDP Industry Employment, Local Government Areas (2022 Boundaries) (POW) Local Government Areas (2022 Boundaries) (UR) Australian Bureau Statistics National Input-Output Table. Australian National Accounts: Input-Output Tables 2019-20 financial year. Table 5. Industry industry flow table (direct allocation imports). Last updated: 27/05/2022 Next release: 17/03/2023

title: EIAT User Guide
text: Regional Input-Output Tables used tool derived 115 sector Input-Output table provided Australian Bureau Statistics. Due availability data regional level, table aggregated 19 ANZSIC sector Input-Output Table Australia. table basis Regional Input-Output Tables. Broadly, Input-Output modelling based direct coefficients - sales purchases industry relate total production industry. direct coefficients calculated Australian Input-Output Table. Location Quotients used determine industry region can considered significant industry across Australia. Significant determines whether region capable supplying local industries proportion country whole. , region supplies proportionally less local industries. region never supplies proportionally country whole. Regional employment used determine whether industry region can considered significant. Location Quotient defined : \[ LQ_{,r} = \frac{E_{,r}}{\sum_i E_{,r}}/\frac{\sum_r E_{,r}}{\sum_{,r} E_{,r}} \] \(E_{,r}\) FTE employment region \(r\) industry \(\). industry region said significant \(LQ_{,r} \geq 1\).

title: Create Regional Input-Output Tables
text: goal eiat consolidate production Regional Input-Output Tables Local Government Area level use Economic Impact Assessment Tool (EIAT) developed Australian Industrial Transformation Institute Australian Urban Research Infrastructure Network (AURIN). EIAT can found . includes automatic updating Regional Input-Output Tables year Australian Bureau Statistics updates Australian National Accounts: Input-Output Tables.

title: Create Regional Input-Output Tables
text: Regional Input-Output Tables derived two main sources, Australian Bureau Statistics.

title: Create Regional Input-Output Tables
text: National Accounts updated annual basis. package takes 115 sector Input-Output Industry Group flow table Table 5. Industry industry flow table (direct allocation imports) FTE total employment industry table Table 20. Employment industry consolidates 19 sector ANZSIC flow table. Australian 19 sector Input-Output table basis Regional Input-Output tables. Friday 2:00 3:00 AEDT CI process check updates tables, necessary, update Regional Input-Output tables.

title: Generate Data For Regional Input-Output Table Creation — get_data
text: Location Quotients used determine industry region "significant" industry country. , whether region capable supplying local industries proportion country whole. , region supplies proportionally less local industries. Regional employment used determine whether industry region "significant" significance defined : \[ LQ_{,r} = \frac{E_{, r}}{\sum_i{E_{, r}}} / \frac{\sum_{r}{E_{, r}}}{\sum_{r,}{E_{,r}}} \] \(E_{,r}\) FTE Employment region r, industry . industry region said significant \(LQ_{,r} >=1\). instances, regional coefficient supplying industry assumed national coefficient supplying industry. Otherwise, regional coefficient estimated \(LQ_{,r}\times a_{,r}\) \(a_{,r}\) national coefficient.

title: Generate Data For Regional Input-Output Table Creation — get_data
Local employment — get_local_employment
text: Return local employment specified local government area. Local employment refers live work region. Data can adjusted remove Inadequately described stated employment. adjustment process assumes employment Inadequately described stated distribution employment industry reported data. example, local employment Inadequately described totals 20, local employment Agriculture, Forestry Fishing region 5% total local employment, 5% * 20 Inadequately described employment proportioned Agriculture, Forestry Fishing. Data derived Australian Bureau Statistics Census - Employment industry place work usual residence 2011, 2016 2021.

title: Local employment — get_local_employment
text: region Local Government Area (LGA). See: get_available_regions() year census year draw data . Must census year (2011, 2016, 2021). adjust logical. default (TRUE) adjusts data remove Inadequately described stated.

title: Local employment — get_local_employment
text: dataframe local employment region industry.

title: Regional employment — get_regional_employment
text: Return regional employment specified local government area. Regional employment refers work region live outside region. Data can adjusted remove Inadequately described stated employment. adjustment process assumes employment Inadequately described stated distribution employment industry reported data. example, regional employment Inadequately described totals 20, regional employment Agriculture, Forestry Fishing region 5% total regional employment, 5% * 20 Inadequately described employment proportioned Agriculture, Forestry Fishing. Data derived Australian Bureau Statistics Census - Employment industry place work 2011, 2016 2021.

title: Regional employment — get_regional_employment
